item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, October 4, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Getting my daily news from a dot matrix printer (262 points | 91 comments)
2. 12 Months of Mandarin (145 points | 59 comments)
3. Meta Movie Gen (459 points | 415 comments)
4. Show HN: One – A new React framework unifying web, native and local-first (141 points | 39 comments)
5. Show HN: Chebyshev approximation calculator (172 points | 30 comments)
6. ESP32: leaving love notes and entering demoscene territory (2022) (62 points | 8 comments)
7. Experimental web browser optimized for rabbit-holing (435 points | 88 comments)
8. Why does man print "gimme gimme gimme" at 00:30? (2017) (741 points | 328 comments)
9. Gym Class (YC W22) – Hiring First Mobile Game Engineer ( | hide)
10. Show HN: A tool for creating chord charts on the go (87 points | 23 comments)
11. ESP8266 Analog Broadcast Television Interface (53 points | 7 comments)
12. Show HN: kew – A Terminal Music Player for Linux (85 points | 28 comments)
13. NumPy QuadDType: Quadruple Precision for Everyone (39 points | 37 comments)
14. Computer scientists combine two 'beautiful' proof methods (23 points | discuss)
15. Vaccines, past and present (15 points | 3 comments)
16. Reverse engineering and dismantling Kekz headphones (142 points | 25 comments)
17. Robert Dennard, DRAM Pioneer, has died (315 points | 26 comments)
18. 52 Factorial (24 points | 10 comments)
19. Manna – Two Views of Humanity's Future (5 points | 2 comments)
20. Depth Pro: Sharp monocular metric depth in less than a second (79 points | 13 comments)
21. Were RNNs all we needed? (445 points | 229 comments)
22. Patent troll Sable pays up, dedicates all its patents to the public (1228 points | 359 comments)
23. Why Is Light So Fast? (52 points | 68 comments)
24. New research says "blue zones" can be explained by flawed data (157 points | 111 comments)
25. MikroPhone: A privacy enhanced, simple and featured RISC-V mobile phone (198 points | 69 comments)
26. Perfctl: Stealthy malware targeting Linux servers (119 points | 30 comments)
27. Canvas is a new way to write and code with ChatGPT (894 points | 644 comments)
28. Why and how we’re migrating many of our servers from Linux to the BSDs (286 points | 169 comments)
29. The Silk Road (2023) (55 points | 11 comments)
30. Self-locking and stiffening deployable tubular structures (28 points | 1 comment)
